titleStmt.title: A declaration concerning the present treaty of peace, between His Majesty and both Houses of Parliament. Containing the severall reasons, why the wel-affected subjects of this kingdome ought to imbrace either peace, or warre, His Majesty assenting, or dissenting the present propositions, propounded by the high court of Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J.H. and Hen. Hutton,

notesStmt.note: A Puritan tract in justification of a belligerent Parliamentary policy.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
